text:
binbuild.sh does not allow customization of configure arguments, thus forcing 
one to edit this script to either add them or to comment out the configure line.

Instead, binbuild.sh should use config.nice when it exists, augmenting these 
options with layout, etc, settings as needed.
creator: jessh@ptc.com

text:
binbuild.sh is a script for building apache binary releases for distribution
on the apache site.  It is not a generic tool for building apache (that is
./configure).  As such, it doesn't make sense to make it configurable.
creator: slive@apache.org

text:
I see nothing wrong with the default invocation of binbuild.sh producing the
binaries as Apache distributes them, but:
  1) These builds omit critical things like building with DSO support,
     not to mention EAPI, mod_ssl, etc, all of which (barring legal
     wranglings) should be made part of standard binary sets.
  2) Though binbuild.sh is easily hackable to fit the need, the lack of
     a non-standard binary distributable build tool is rather glaring
     and inexplicable.
creator: jessh@ptc.com
